node.title: Olympic gold medalist Mikaela Shiffrin tests positive for COVID-19
node.description: The skiing star said she is "doing well" despite the positive test.
node.content: ["Mikaela Shiffrin, the two-time Olympic gold medalist, says she has tested positive for COVID-19. Shiffrin, 26, says she is doing well but will not compete in this week's Alpine Ski World Cup races in Lienz, Austria.\u00a0", "\"I'm following protocol and isolating, & I will miss Lienz. Best of luck to my teammates\u2026I'll be cheering for you. Thank you all for your support. I'll see you in the new year,\" she tweeted Monday.\u00a0", "\ud83d\udc4b, I wanted to let you all know that I\u2019m doing well, but unfortunately I had a positive COVID test. I\u2019m following protocol and isolating, & I will miss Lienz. Best of luck to my teammates\u2026I\u2019ll be cheering for you. Thank you all for your support. I\u2019ll see you in the new year. \ud83e\udd0d pic.twitter.com/YxZnwWP6f1", "Shiffrin, who won gold in the slalom at the 2014 Sochi Olympics and won gold in the giant slalom at the 2018 Pyeongchang Olympics, is expected to be a top contender in this year's Beijing Olympics, which is set for February 4. The skiing star's participation is up in the air as China redoubles its efforts to control new virus outbreaks.", "Shiffrin is the latest elite skier to test positive for COVID-19. Former overall champion Lara Gut-Behrami, Austrian world champion Katharina Liensberger and New Zealand's Alice Robinson have all recently tested positive for the virus.\u00a0", "Lienz will host the women's giant slalom and slalom races on Tuesday and Wednesday. Shiffrin is the current women's overall leader, but may lose out on retaining her\u00a0overall World Cup title if she doesn't recover in time. Italy's Sofia Goggia trails Shiffrin by 115 points, with only a few months left in the season. Last year, Shiffrin won her sixth gold and a ninth career medal from the worlds \u2014 one more than Lindsey Vonn at the top of the all-time list of American medalists.", "Christopher Brito is a social media producer and trending writer for CBS News, focusing on sports and stories that involve issues of race and culture."]
